Posts.Content: I understand how you feel . My condition was almost exactly the same as you described - although I only had four tumours and not the m type one ! I remember feeling exactly the same as you describe - the health professionals were great but after my operation I felt like I had been cast adrift with the tamoxifen as my life raft and I worried daily about reoccurrence. However as I had my mastectomy last May  its now eight  months on I feel so much better about it all- I’ve now pretty much picked up my old life from April last year when I was diagnosed .  I do still think about the possibility of reoccurrence but far less . As time goes on I think you , hopefully , will feel the same . I’m happy to chat about any aspect of it if you’d like to . Best wishes x
Posts.Title: Concerned about treatment plan.

Posts.Content: The name comes from the welsh part in me ! They told me I was grade and stage  one to two after the biopsies and ultrasound  and then itemised each of the four tumours individually by name and size after the mastectomy  - all were different types and sizes- the biggest was 11 mm  . As I had so many and all over the breast including the nipple , mastectomy was the only treatment offered .  Like you I wanted to have every  body scan going  as I didn’t even have a lump - mine was found by my first routine mammogram at age 50- and I became rather paranoid thinking that if I hadn’t had a lump or was not unwell in any way , what else could be going on in my body that I didn’t know about . But I then realised this is impractical if not impossible and not guaranteed to pick up cancers anyway . Time is  definately a healer in this case and your worries will lessen . I read these forums on a daily basis though and find they really help me allay some of my fears . Honestly it does get better - sometimes I’m only reminded of what I’ve been through is at night in bed when my new perky left breast is sticking up  nicely whilst my “old” right one is to be found somewhere way under my armpit ......

Posts.Content: Ive always struggled with maintaining a healthy weight , I’m 51 , 5 foot 7 and it’s varied between a low 9-10 and a high  13-4 over the years . At diagnosis last April  I weighed 11-9 and I’ve been on tamoxifen for a year and it crept up again to. 12-4 although I  don’t think tamoxifen caused me to put on weight if I’m honest I’ve just been greedy .  I hope to have a breast reduction this year on my “good” breast to match my implant breast for size and perkiness and therefore  need to reduce it as much as possible naturally before the operation , so six weeks ago I embarked on 1000 calories a day diet . I have managed to lose 12 pounds so far , a pretty much constant 2 pounds a week. Ive made up my own diet , mostly consisting of shop bought soups , vegetables and fruit and whilst very boring and repetitive , it’s filling and more importantly it’s working . Ive had to stop any form of socialising though and no alcohol as these trigger me to overeat . I’ve used the my fitness pal app which keeps a track of the calories and it’s been really very helpful .  I’ve not had chemo or radiotherapy , just a mastectomy , so don’t know to what extent these may affect your body’s ability to lose weight , but hope this experience may encourage people to know some people can lose weight whilst on tamoxifen .  I do understand  how you feel about your body , having a scarred nipple - less 32D left breast and a 32H right one is bad enough , but an extra two stone does nothing for your confidence ! I do hope you find an eating plan which works for you to help you lose the weight and also  continued good health and happiness .
Posts.Title: how to lose weight on tamoxifen

Posts.Content: Hi - this happened to me after my mastectomy where the ibuprofen and paracetamol weren't touching the nerve pain . I put up with it for weeks and rang the breast care nurses who refered  me to my gp . I got a telephone appointment with my gp who basically was prepared to  prescribed me anything I wanted ( in a responsible way I would add ) . I had researched the pain type and worked out amiltriptaline was most suitable for my type of pain . I  Picked up the prescription the same day , started it hours later and within 24 hours pain was gone .your pharmacy won't have the strengths the gp can prescribe so I'd recommend going straight to the gp.  Good luck xxx
Posts.Title: Useless !

Posts.Content: Hi Kerry - congratulations on nesting the end of chemo . I was lucky and only needed a mastectomy with immediate implant and then on to tamoxifen . Like you I was dreading it and prepared my husband for every possible side effect . However it's been eleven eeeks now and apart from the odd warm moment - I can't even call it a hot flush - I've been fine. I think you should give it a go and reevaluate if And when you do get adverse reactions as I think you could regret it if you don't throw everything at it. Hope this helps your decision - feel free to ask any questions if you'd like . Best wishes x

Posts.Content: Thanks for that , I also read they weren't that good but based on what you've said I'll definately try your one. I've Only been on tamoxifen for five weeks . I've not had real full in body sweats yet - just some warm moments in bed but I suspect I have that joy coming ! I've also bought a brilliant little three speed portable fan which folds up in to your handbag or becomes a mini desk fan  - amazing effect on third speed . That's from amazon about.  12-99 or 9-99 if you get it from a Chinese stockist on there .
